column2: pròpter qŭod locútus sum~; ego aŭtem humiliátus sum nìmis. ^ I have believed
column3: therefore have I spoken~; but I have been humbled exceedingly.

column2: «~Òmnis hòmo mendax.~»^ I said in my excess
pro òmnibus qŭaĕ retrìbuit mìchi~? ^ What shall I render to the Lord
column3: for all that he renders unto me~?

column2: et nomen Dòmini invocábo. ^ I will take the chalice of salvation~; and I will call upon the name of the Lord.

column1: 5 ^ Vota mea Dòmino reddem coram òmni pòpulo ejus. ^ I will pay my vows to the Lord before all his people.
6 ^ Prețiósa in conspèctu Dòmini mors sanctórum ejus. ^ Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

column2: qŭia ego sèrvus tuus~; ego sèrvus tuus
column3: et fílius ancìllaĕ tuaĕ~; dirupìsti vìncula mea. ^ O Lord
column4: for I am thy servant~; I am thy servant
column5: and the son of thy handmaid~; thou hast broken my bonds.

column2: et nomen Dòmini invocábo. ^ I will sacrifice to thee the sacrifice of praise
column3: and I will call upon the name of the Lord.

column1: 9 ^ Vota mea Dòmino reddem in conspèctu òmnis pòpuli ejus
column2: ^ I will pay my vows to the Lord in the sight of all his people

column3: Jerúsalim. ^ In the courts of the house of the Lord
